pullRequest.title: Improve Bulk and OAuth Support #1110
pullRequest.bodyText:
Add Support for SQL Type SmallInt
Add Support for multi-column unique constraints
Improve Foreign Key Constraints for self-referenced foreign keys
(JavaBatch) and update BaseObject to work with FK
Improve Foreign Key Constraints for Alternative Targets (columns don't
match)
Add Restrictive Grants for OAuth Tables
Add Restrictive Grants for Java Batch Tables
Add Feature Flag for Grants in Schema / Main
Added SchemaPrinter support for OAuth and JBatch
Tuned logging for DerbyAdapter (tablespace is now log level fine)
Tuned logging for ParametersUtil ( changed warning name-code match to
log level fine)
Tuned DerbyAdapter warnings

Indirectly fixed...

Add postgresql support for grant command of the schema tool #946

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide pbastide@us.ibm.com

commit.message:
Improve Bulk and OAuth Support #1110

- Add Support for SQL Type SmallInt
- Add Support for multi-column unique constraints
- Improve Foreign Key Constraints for self-referenced foreign keys
(JavaBatch) and update BaseObject to work with FK
- Improve Foreign Key Constraints for Alternative Targets (columns don't
match)
- Add Restrictive Grants for OAuth Tables
- Add Restrictive Grants for Java Batch Tables
- Add Feature Flag for Grants in Schema / Main
- Added SchemaPrinter support for OAuth and JBatch
- Tuned logging for DerbyAdapter (tablespace is now log level fine)
- Tuned logging for ParametersUtil ( changed warning name-code match to
log level fine)
- Tuned DerbyAdapter warnings

Indirectly fixed...
- Add postgresql support for grant command of the schema tool #946

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Fix for JBatch

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText:
maybe create these up front like we do in FHIRSchemaGenerator.  then, replaced these four lines with:
.addPrivileges(List<GroupPrivilege>)

in each of the add*Table methods
Fix spacing
Drop / Fix
cool so, we support or are going to support upgrading of OAUTH and BATCH tables.
Do we assume the javabatch tables are in the same database as fhir data but with different schema?
if enable this command for postgresql, can we still use the Db2Adapter?
better to use FHIR_JBATCH, because JBATCH is the default schema of javabatch.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -61,5 +61,5 @@
     -->
 
     <batchPersistence jobStoreRef="BatchDatabaseStore"/>
-    <databaseStore dataSourceRef="fhirbatchDS" id="BatchDatabaseStore" schema="JBATCH" tablePrefix=""/>
+    <databaseStore dataSourceRef="fhirbatchDS" id="BatchDatabaseStore" schema="FHIR_BATCH" tablePrefix="" createTables="false"/>

commit.message:
Fix for JBatch

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Fix for JBatch

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Update per PR Review

Add --batch-only
Convert to use .addPrivileges(generateGroupPrivilege())
Converted to FHIR_JBATCH

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: whats the intent of this one?  why not just do it lock-step with the update-schema like we're doing for the OAuth schema?

if it really needs to be separate, maybe we should split it into three actions?

--update-schema
--update-batch-schema
--update-oauth-schema

Like have those set the createFhirSchema, createOauthSchema, and createJavaBatchSchema flags respectively, then base the update on those flags alone...

when i did the oauth schema, i was going to do something like that until i decided that the separate actions weren't really needed and so i just did the oauth ones as part of the normal create and update schema actions
haha, just read this one and at least i understand the motivation for the --batch-only flag now

commit.message:
Add Grant Actions and FHIR Persistence fhir-persistence-schema #1110

- Introduce CommonUtil to aid in simplifying the layout of Main.java
- Add checkCompatibility to each adapter
- Cleanup SchemaPrinter to support the new models
- Move the methods around to logically organize
- Remove references to old defects
- Add deprecation flag for tenantKey
- Reference Constants from DerbyBootstrapper
- Improve Layout of Main.java
- Update schema from bulkdata.xml

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: maybe better to show the reason like it's not needed anymore or not useful anymore because it's handled in fhirdaoimp..
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -94,6 +95,7 @@ public void setTenantId(String tenantId) throws FHIRException {
      * @param base64
      * @throws FHIRException if the given value is not a valid Base64 string
      */
+    @Deprecated

nodes.bodyText: does -1 mean no limit?

does this always return true?
the comments for --checkCompatibility "checks feature compatibility" seems a little bit confusing for me...
I didn't notice this before, could you help to tell what's this used for?
postgresql.md is empty, is it the same as db2.md? if so, maybe should not name as db2.md ...

nodes.bodyText: better to change to FHIR_JBATCH

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * @throws FHIRException if the given value is not a valid Base64 string
          
          
            
                 * @throws FHIRException if the given value is not a valid Base64 string
          
          
            
                 * @deprecated tenantKey should be looked up on-the-fly from the fhir server configuration (e.g. from 
          
          
            
                 *             FHIRDbDAOImpl.getConnection() in fhir-persistence-jdbc)
what if we already configured either DB2 or postgresql as job repo? will this still try to bootstrap derby job repo ...

commit.message:
Add Grant Actions and FHIR Persistence fhir-persistence-schema #1110

- Refactor the Grant logic
- Refactor Procedure and Functions and separate the application

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: is it ever used anywhere?
good catch.  i wonder how that second OAUTH_SCHEMANAME has slipped in there...

commit.message:
Update for conflict

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Apply suggestions from code review

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

Co-authored-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

issue 1110

- Remove unused import from OldFhirSchemaGenerator
- Update to FHIR_BATCH_GRANT_GROUP for Batch
- Boostrap only executes when true and the batch datasource is derby
- Refactor to support Default String or Default Smallint

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>
Merge branch 'issue-1110' of github.com:IBM/FHIR into issue-1110

nodes.bodyText: I thought you may want to check the datasource configuration in server.xml, but this also works. thanks!

commit.message:
issue-1110

- Fix references to db2

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: I thought to limit the DB differences in the datautil/model layer, so I had added dbtype for the procedures, and then check dbtype before apply the objects.

commit.message:
issue-1110

- Fix table naming issue
- Add test for postgres

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

issue-1110

- Boolean / SmallInt management for Postgres

Signed-off-by: Paul Bastide <pbastide@us.ibm.com>

issue #1110 - string literal default handling

now addClobColumn will automatically wrap the defaultVal in single
quotes (since the framework doesn't do this any more)

also removed the unused com.ibm.fhir.database.utils.AddColumn

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

issue #1110 - fixed message for java batch bootsrapping

it accidentally listed the OAuthDB JNDI name when it should have been
for batch

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
